title: PTO & Vacation Value Calculator
description: Calculate exactly how much your paid time off and holidays are worth in monetary terms.
methodSummary: Daily Value = Annual Salary / 260 planned work days.
Total PTO Value = (PTO Days + Holidays) × Daily Value.
Real Salary = Base Salary + Total monetary value of your time off.
assumptions: Calculated based on 260 standard work days per year (5 days/week × 52 weeks).
Assumes PTO is fully paid at your current base salary rate.
insights: A 25-day vacation package is effectively a ~10% bonus compared to a role with no PTO.
When comparing job offers, a higher salary with fewer PTO days might actually be worth less 'per hour' than a lower salary with more time off.

faqs.a: Public holidays are paid days you aren't working. To see the full value of your 'non-working' paid time, they must be counted alongside your personal PTO.

faqs.q: Can I use this for unpaid leave?
faqs.a: This tool calculates the value of paid leave. For unpaid leave, you are effectively losing the 'Value per Day' identified here.

faqs.q: How does this vary by country?
faqs.a: The logic remains the same. Use your country's standard work days per year (usually 260) to get an accurate daily value regardless of location.
If your sick leave is paid and separate from PTO, you can add those days to the 'Holidays' field to see their total impact on your compensation value.
For unlimited PTO, use the average number of days employees actually take in your company. 20-25 days is common for benchmarking purposes.
Yes, PTO is generally taxed as ordinary income, the same as your regular salary. The 'value' represented here is the gross value.
